001package org.consensusj.rx.zeromq;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.BackpressureStrategy;
004import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
005import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.FlowableEmitter;
006import org.slf4j.Logger;
007import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
008import org.zeromq.ZMQ;
009import org.zeromq.ZMQException;
010import org.zeromq.ZMsg;
011import zmq.ZError;
012
013import java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory;
014
015/**
016 *  Factory class for creating {@code Flowable<ZMsg>} from a {@link ZMQ.Socket}. The created {@link Flowable}
017 *  will receive a multiplexed stream of {@link ZMsg} (i.e. {@code ZMsg} for all topics.) Typically
018 *  these multiplexed {@code Flowable<ZMsg>} are created by a {@link RxZmqContext} which also de-multiplexes them.
019 *  <p>
020 *  TODO: Write some tests!!
021 */
022public class ZMsgSocketFlowable {
023    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ZMsgSocketFlowable.class);
024    private static final ThreadFactory defaultThreadFactory = runnable -> new Thread(runnable, "ZeroMQ Receiver");
025
026    static Flowable<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket, BackpressureStrategy backpressureStrategy) {
027        return createFromSocket(socket, backpressureStrategy, defaultThreadFactory);
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * The created {@link Flowable} will create a new receiving loop thread per subscriber, which may
032     * not be what you want. To support multiple subscribers use {@link RxZmqContext}, or something
033     * similar, or directly use a {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.FlowableProcessor}.
034     * 
035     * @param socket A connected socket, ready to receive messages with {@link ZMsg#recvMsg(ZMQ.Socket)}
036     * @param backpressureStrategy specifies what to do if subscribers aren't able to receive data fast enough
037     * @param threadFactory used to create the thread that runs the receive loop
038     * @return A "cold" Flowable
039     */
040    static Flowable<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket, BackpressureStrategy backpressureStrategy, ThreadFactory threadFactory) {
041        return Flowable.create(emitter -> {
042            Thread thread = threadFactory.newThread(new ZmqReceiveLoop(socket, emitter));
043            thread.start();
044            emitter.setCancellable(() -> {
045                thread.interrupt();
046                thread.join();
047            });
048        }, backpressureStrategy);
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * A runnable {@link ZMQ.Socket} receive loop that is can be cancelled with {@link Thread#interrupt}
053     * and sends messages and errors to the supplied {@link FlowableEmitter}.
054     */
055    private static class ZmqReceiveLoop implements Runnable {
056        private final ZMQ.Socket socket;
057        private final FlowableEmitter<ZMsg> emitter;
058
059        /**
060         * @param socket A connected socket, ready to receive messages with {@link ZMsg#recvMsg(ZMQ.Socket)}
061         * @param emitter should be supplied by {link @Flowable#create}
062         */
063        private ZmqReceiveLoop(ZMQ.Socket socket, FlowableEmitter<ZMsg> emitter) {
064            this.socket = socket;
065            this.emitter = emitter;
066        }
067
068        @Override
069        public void run() {
070            log.info("Starting receiving thread.");
071            while (!Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted()) {
072                try {
073                    ZMsg message = ZMsg.recvMsg(socket);
074                    if (message != null) {
075                        emitter.onNext(message);
076                    }
077                } catch (Exception e) {
078                    if (e instanceof ZMQException && ((ZMQException) e).getErrorCode() == ZError.ETERM) {
079                        log.info("Got ZError.ETERM");
080                        // Is this the error we get when upstream closes the channel?
081                        emitter.onComplete();
082                    } else if (e instanceof ZMQException && ((ZMQException) e).getErrorCode() == ZError.EINTR) {
083                        log.info("Ignoring ZError.EINTR");
084                        // Should we send an onComplete when we are cancelled?
085                        emitter.onComplete();
086                    } else {
087                        log.error("Exception: ", e);
088                        emitter.onError(e);
089                    }
090                    break;
091                }
092            }
093            log.info("Closing ZMQ.Socket.");
094            socket.setLinger(0);
095            socket.close();
096        }
097    }
098
099}
